    • Method Detail

      • addLanguage

        public void addLanguage(Language language)
        Registers a language.
        Parameters:
        language - the needed language to register

      • setDefaultLanguage

        public void setDefaultLanguage(java.lang.String languagecode)
        Sets the default language. This is used when players haven't chosen a their own language.
        Parameters:
        languagecode - the default language's languagecode

      • getLanguages

        public java.util.Set<Language> getLanguages()
        Gets all registered languages.
        Returns:
        returns a set of all registered languages

      • getLanguage

        public Language getLanguage(java.lang.String languagecode)
        Gets a registered language by its languagecode.
        Parameters:
        languagecode - the languagecode to get the registered language from
        Returns:
        registered language by the given languagecode, null if there is no registered language with this languagecode.

      • setPlayerLanguage

        public void setPlayerLanguage(org.bukkit.entity.Player player,
                     java.lang.String languagecode)
        Sets the player's language with a languagecode.
        Parameters:
        player - player to set the language to
        languagecode - languagecode to set the language to

      • getPlayerTranslation

        public java.lang.String getPlayerTranslation(org.bukkit.entity.Player player,
                                    java.lang.String key)
        Gets the translation of a player with a key.

        Example: The player has as language: Dutch Dutch file: skywars.start: "Het spel is gestart!" skywars.end: "Het spel is gestopt!" If the key is: skywars.start then it returns "Het spel is gestart!"

        Parameters:
        player - player to get the translation for
        key - key to search for in the configuration file
        Returns:
        returns the value(translation) for the given player and given key
